"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545dbdfd6368727ae9fc0000#post_545dbdfd6368727ae9fc0000
A todos nos pasa tarde o temprano. Mira como me rompió el corazón místico. En fin, ahora la batería de mi tablet se agita y debo irme, irme a dormir al sillón porque mi cuarto lo ocupan unas personas que en mi vida he visto pero que según son tíos. Además ya perdimos la hegemonía del topico, pero nos la oasamos bien. A ver cuando nuestros caminos vuelven a cruzarse, cuidaos noble caballero.

Ah. Also. Can you recommend any really good rider series? The Fourze one has me legitimately interested. The main guy is practically the elements of harmony if given a human form; can't not like that.
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545dc40e6368721b3ac90100#post_545dc40e6368721b3ac90100
For Heisei rider, There's Fourze, Like you just mentioned. Kuuga and Agito are highly recommended to those who can handle slower paces. I loved Ryuki enough that I could stomach Nihon subs. (Which as I've said quite a few times before, Are terribad) 555 through Decade are not recommended. (They're not good enough to be worth going through Nihon subs IMO, And the ones I would recommend have worse Nihon subs than usual.) I don't think I've seen a single person who hates W and OOO, So I'd say check those out, Wizard is apparently really boring, And Gaim is written by Urobuchi. (Nuf said) Also, I have nothing to say about Drive because I know nothing about it.

Before the Reboot, I recommend ZO & J. (They condense the showa rider formula into about 40-50 minutes) Also, I loved Black. (Though It's very formulaic)
